description: Sulfur is a yellow nonmetal known for its role in biological molecules, industrial chemicals, and environmental processes. It appears in proteins, volcanic emissions, and numerous minerals. Industry uses sulfur to produce sulfuric acid, one of the most important chemicals worldwide. Sulfur compounds support fertilizers, batteries, and pharmaceuticals. Although some sulfur odors are unpleasant, the element itself is stable and widely useful. Its presence across natural and industrial systems highlights its broad importance.
name: Sulfur
